name: Newport Beachside Hotel and Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely horrible service from management. I have never been treated so rudely from a hotel in my life. I really had a loss for words. They sold our room out when we got there after it was already paid for. So we got the "executive suite" which was more like the basement of a motel 6. On the last day of our stay, they said they mistakenly gave us the room and said we had to either leave the hotel or move rooms after we were already paid for. The rooms are decorated horrifically. It looks like all the decor was bought from big lots or a flea market. The rooms were dirty, the hotel was very dirty and smelled. They charge you around $20 extra dollars per day for no reason except for things that usually come free with most hotels. Charged us $250 for a comforter because of a small coffee stain, did not even notice until I got home and checked my card statement. Absolutely the worst hotel experience of my life. I really hope this place is up for demo. This place spent 10 times more money on thier curb appeal than the overall quality of the hotel and the rooms. SOMEONE FROM THE CLEANING STAFF STOLE MY DIGITAL CAMERA! They also tried to hide my brand new $250 sunglasses by stashing them behind the dresser! dont leave anything out!
reviews.title: absolutely horrible service

likes.disliked: — the staff of the hotel and the hotel itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Newport Beach Resort, staying for 4 nights in a lovely ocean view suite. We contacted the hotel directly to ensure we reserved a room on an upper floor with a direct ocean view. If you book online, although cheaper, you cannot get this guarantee and perhaps that is why some people have had problems. We do not have kids and were a bit wary of the resort activities, but all of it was great. It is easy to participate if you want, but easy to avoid as well.
reviews.title: Great Resort!

likes.liked: — ocean views, proximity to the beach and other amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful, the suite was comfortable and large...yes, the decor in the rooms is a bit old-Miami but we like that. The view and balcony were spectacular-- just what we needed for a relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
Kids Loved It
reviews.text: The surrounding area is quite nice as well-- great breakfast and coffee at El Tropico and we had 2 fantastic dinners at Fisher's Seafood. We had appetizers at Michael's in the hotel which was quite good, and an ala carte breakfast in the cafe which was average. The special drinks at the pool bar are good value although the food options are a bit lacking.

If you are in the mood for fitness, there is a great gym across the street, I think it is called Miami Beach Fitness. John gave us a great deal for 2 x 3 day passes and we did everything from boot camp to Hatha yoga. It is really a fantastic gym!
reviews.title: Always Overbooked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all we are pleased, but had no idea pier was closed. When we booked that was one of the main interest. The sign says it was closed in June . This should have been posted on the web site.Also the hot tub is down for the whole week we are staying here.When I repeatly asked at the front desk they did'nt know it was closed.They called the maintenance dept . They found out they are replacing plumbing. The $10. a day for across the street parking is a little high. The bathrooms are nice they offer shampoo but no conditioner,so make sure to bring your own. The breakfast buffet is definitly is not worth 33.00 for two people. They are also doing a lot of construction work, which takes away from the relaxing vaction we were looking for.
reviews.title: Could have been better
Great place. Great people
reviews.text: the main thing they have going for them is haul-over is with-in walking distance.

reviews.title: Skip this place...
reviews.text: The hotel was great! Super views of the beach and the ocean. The sunrise over the water was worth geting up early every day. And the staff was very friendly. The hotel is upgrading almost everything, including the restaurants. Lot s of activities for the kids. We heard many languages spoken, so good international vacation spot, nice mix. We will go again.
I stayed at this "resort" during the third week of August. The facility is under construction, I guess they are finally upgrading the property after many years of neglect.
reviews.title: didnt mension they was under cunstruction or remodeling

likes.disliked: — no one told me i going to be in a hotel in contruction

reviews.text: Housekeeping service is spotty at best. I had to call many times just to get the room serviced, and they typically didn't do much other than change the towels, if you are lucky.
reviews.title: Good Spring Break Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our stay through a timeshare agency and I must say that we loved our stay.
reviews.title: Loved The Newport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and nice brass highlights on the fixtures in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Could have been better

likes.disliked: — noise, inconsiderate staff, poor upkeep of beach, no place for non smokers on beach, expensive

reviews.text: The pool area is very nice with a tiki bar located at the end of the pool. Drinks and food can get pricey (10.00 cocktail) at the tiki bar. Just remember that 15% gratuity is already included on your order. There is also a restaurant on the pier (we did not try it though).
reviews.title: Great Location....ok for the $$

reviews.text: The resort is located in Sunny Isles approximately 20 minutes north of South Beach. Believe me after spending all day at South Beach you will look forward to staying at the Newport. They also have a bar in house and live entertainment. You could easily spend a couple of days at the resort.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

likes.disliked: — Cost for the internet and room service doesn't serve late enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and conveyed a cheerful environment. The concierge's are fantastic and take their time out to help you and you actually feel that they are there to help only you. The concierge also gave us passes to Prive' nightclub in South Beach. We went right in front of the line and they pulled the velvet rope up for us (keep in mind the passes are good only to 12:00am, after that 20.00 cover charge).
reviews.title: Really bad service even the waitress does not speak English

reviews.text: Stayed at the newport last weekend.. What a great time we had there ... took our 2 teenagers and they also loved it.... hotel was nice, beach was nice, room was nice.....we stayed in the 2 bedroom sweet, had plenty of room... overlooked the pool and ocean just as they described...beautiful view... could hear the poolside music playing from poolside during the day when we were in our room sounded so relaxing... didn't spend much time in the room though as the pool and beach were to die for.... there was always someone there to wait on you whether you were poolside or laying on the beach... ate mostly at the hotel.. food was good enough that we did not have to search out other places... if you have never been to miami and are wondering if the ocean will be teal blue like you see in the pictures.. the answer is yes,yes,yes... ocean was breat htaking....we will definately go back SOON.. and stay at the newport..very affordable and all the staff was very friendly and helpful... oh yeah and the pool water was warm... tiki bar by the pool opens everday at 11:00 a.m...great margaritas and hurricanes..
reviews.title: Awesome Resort

reviews.text: My fiancé and I chose the Newport Beachside Hotel and Resort based on the reports shared by others on Trip Advisor. We were very happy with the hotel. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. The staff was always accommodating and pleasant. The room was very clean and they changed the towels everyday despite the fact we planned to follow the “save water” plan and use the towels twice. The breakfast buffet was worth the $10 per person.
reviews.title: This is a great place to stay

reviews.text: We really enjoyed the beach it was always clean, though some seaweed would drift in by the end of the day. It’s an ocean what do you expect? There is construction next door but I did not find the noise bothersome.
reviews.title: just fine and a great deal for spring break
A very nice family friendly beach hotel in Miami
reviews.text: The restaurants in the hotel are good. There is also a great seafood restaurant within a 5 minute walk from the hotel, called Capt. Nate’s Seafood Grill Market and Bar. The staff is very welcoming and they treat you like family. The seafood is fresh and cooked just the way you want it. The best part is the prices are quite inexpensive. Our bill was less than $35.00 for two for dinner.

reviews.title: amazing resort!
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Newport Beachside and will surely go back again.

reviews.title: Wonderful Place
reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying that I read all the reviews on TripAdvisor before staying at this hotel, and I had some reservations about it because some of the reviews included some really negative comments. However, despite what some of those reviews said, we did not encounter any problems with the staff (they were helpful and accomodating) or the hotel rooms (definitely no bugs or anything like that), and there were no problems with unsavory hotel guests or noise.

I have stayed at this hotel a number of times when visiting friends in South Florida. It has an excellent location with the beach right on the back with a straight shot down to South Beach. We have three small children and they love the hotel for the beach, pool and other activities that they run in the hotel geared for the little ones. We feel this is a perfect hotel for people with kids in that it is affordable and seems to be geared for this type of crowd. On our last stay in March, we notices a lot of improvements to the hotel. The rooms seem to be under renovation and the lobby was redone. It looks very clean. While we do not have the need for this, it seemed that they were either constructing or renovating a ballroom on the second floor. I would imagine it is done by now. Overall, we would have to say this hotel appears to be on the upswing from our prior stays as they appear to be upgrading the facility. The price is right for our budget as well. I am sure we will go back next time we are in the area.
reviews.title: Old Standby With Many Improvements

reviews.text: I recommend this hotel highly. Our room was lovely; although on the compact side, it was beautifully decorated and the space was wisely used. The view was magnificent! All other areas of the hotel were well-maintained - the lobby, elevators, pool, beach, etc. were all clean and most attractive. We especially enjoyed the gorgeous beach with comfortable lounge chairs.
reviews.title: *** Beautiful Property***

likes.liked: — The room decor and the ocean view

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay here so much that we are planning to return for a longer visit.
reviews.title: newport Beach Resort has some hassels...

likes.disliked: — no activities or close attractions. resort does not have any entertainment available other than swimming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the resort for 1 week. If you want to be by the ocean and swimming and enjoying the sun is your primary goal then this resort is for you. Go here to relax by the water. if you desire other activities then please do not stay here as you will be dissapointed as there is nothing else. the decor is nice but only has 1 restaurant which is very limited. we reserved a 1 bedroom suite...the suite looks nothing like the photo that the resort advertises on their site. It is much smaller and affords no privacy between beds like the picture shows. Also the site stated that all rooms had a balcony and they do not. Beach is really nice and so is the pool. hot tub closes at dark which is when most adults want to use it. it is full of children during the day and with only 4 people allowed at a time we never had a chance to actually get into it. elevators are slow and always full. staff very uninformed- could not answer questions we had about the area. there are 2 computers available in the lobby so you can search for local attractions. all attractions are a distance from the resort. no parking at the resort at all. you must pay $10 per day to park across the street behind a gas station. will cost you $15 per day to get a valet to park for you in the same place. NO security for your vehicle is offered. you will also be charged a $10 per day resort fee which the resort site informs you of, but we still have not figured out what it is for. if you want towels outside for the pool or beach you must get in line at a designeated area by the pool, sign for them and if you do not return them to the same place when done you will be charged $20 per towel. you must also rent the umbrellas, and tiki huts to use on the beach if you want one. they are not included with the price of your stay. Game room/arcades could not hold our 13 year olds attention. very few games and most were not working properly. the television channels are terrible!!! news or sex .... if you want to rent a movie it will cost you approximately $11 per movie. they do have a list of rental movies to choose from. just plan on no tv time while at the resort. house keeping will make your bed daily and remove items from the trash can but that is all. they did not clean floors or provide toilet paper. I had to go after toilet paper each time we needed it. on our last day house keeping keyed into the room, even though we had a do not disturb sign hanging on the door, and asked us if we were leaving. it was 8 in the morning and check out was not until 10. there is very little to do around the resort...a few stores and places to eat. no entertainment close. the resort advertises that they provide a lot of activites but they do not. people were wandering all over the resort looking like they had no idea what to do of an evening. lobby is very loud. the resort is not outdated looking like other reviews stated. it looks remodeled and is clean. there are 2 bars by the water. the pier/dock was closed the entire time we were there and has been for some time i gather. also, the resort photo shows that the resort sits kinda off to itself but it does not. there is a huge/tall condo type building towering close on each side. the photo must have been taken before the other buildings were erected. newport beach resort is the smallest building in the area. this place is perfect for adults who just want to get away and do nothing. don't take a family here with a lot of kids as they will be bored when not swimming. also, if you are not a water person this place is not for you as swimming is the entertainment. also, if you stay do not buy tickets from the resort for any outside area attractions. they have more than tripled the cost. buy the tickets online or at the attraction. ft. lauderdale is close and has things to do so does miami and hollywood. you will actually be staying in sunny isles beach if you choose this resort and there just is not a lot here to do so plan on traveling if you seek adventure or activities. the resort does advertise that they have a lot of water activities....this entails of a jet ski ($70 PER 1/2 HOUR), and canoe which also cost extra. If you book your reservations through a third party the staff at the resort will not attempt to help you if there are any problems with your reservations. they will tell you it is out of their hands and indicate that you must take up all issues with whoever you made your reservations through. I think it important to know this. so if your price of stay differs from what you thought you was paying they will not fix the error, if you booked a balcony room and the resort has another room for you then you will not get the balcony......just a couple of examples.
reviews.title: great hotel and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a great hotel and value especially if you have kids. location is great... near beach , has lively pool and activities for kids with counselors!! Which hotel in miami has that?? The parking costs only 10 bucks for self parking which is nothing compared to 25-30 a night in most other hotels. It isn't the nicest chic rooms out there but all were really clean, great attentive staff and lots of great places to eat especially if you have a car. It isn't near south beach if that is your thing. try booking on the hotels website(cheapest) especially if you are a AAA member
reviews.title: Liars.....Cheaters.....and Rude to boot.

likes.liked: — The look on the managers face when was forced by his boss to refund some of my money to get me home!

reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.text: So i spent our Canadian Thanksgiving weekend ( October 5-9th )at this resort in Miami for Miami Carnival....after a long flight and trouble with the car rental company we finally reached the hotel. So we checked in settled into our hotel room just to find out that we had no microwave..(all rooms are supposed to have a microwave) went down to complain they gladly switched us to a bigger room (no view though). Let me just tell you that the beach is gorgeous...during the day it is just poeple from the resort on the beach and chairs are provided. The staff at the resort are extremly friendly. The only complaint was the $10.00 per day parking across the street... it's a hassle when you are going in and out of the hotel. The bar by the pool is kins of a rip off its about 10 bucks for a frozen drink...but you get to keep the glass. Well i went with my two sisters and did we have fun...if the parking were cheaper i would have given an excellent. If you order Pizza only order from Papa Johns across the street...the no name pizza shop that delivers to the hotel sucks. Thats about it...hope i helped!

My friend and I had a wonderful time at this resort. The accomodations are beautiful and you can't ask for a better ocean view. The food at the hotel restaurants was delicious and fulfilling. Our only gripe about the location is the service in the restaurants. We were not aware that tip was included in the bill. We finished our breakfast, left a tip on the table and went up to pay. When we were made aware the tip was included, not a minute had passed, the tip I had left on the table was gone. We noticed because an 18% tip was included, the service was very slow. We would wait 5 or 10 minutes for someone to great us, then another 5 or 10 minutes for drinks. If we asked for anything, we knew it would be another 10 minutes before getting it. It's a wonderful hotel, but be aware the tip is included and service is slow.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Slow Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got this hotel through a Priceline bid of $60 which translates to about $70 a night. That's a good price for a hotel along Miami Beach IMHO. Parking across the street is an extra $10 a night. Local calls are free but (here's a first) calls to 800 numbers are a dollar each. Internet is about $10 a night or three days for $23 or $50 a month. We just used someone's uncencrypted wi-fi for free. We arrived at the hotel about 7 AM after a red-eye flight into Ft. Lauderdale and the hotel was kind enough to let us into our room immediately. Our room was very large and included a microwave and large frig (which was a bit too noisy). No ocean view at this price but that was OK. The hotel is right on the beach, the staff was very friendly and they had quite a few free entertainment events including bingo. They are remodeling the lobby and some of the rooms but that wasn't a problem. I've noticed that Priceline often books us into hotels that are being remodeled - after a successful Priceline bid.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: When I made the hotel reservation online through hotels I used my business credit card and did not have any problem. However when I checked out I used a new credit card received only two weeks earlier to pay for the valet parking and resort charge, about $23.00. I only used this new card once, at this resort hotel. I did not lose the card nor use it since that trip so there was only the one $23.00 charge on it. Last week someone ran the card to the limit with various online websites and I was contacted by the Capitol One fraud department who is investigating. Obviously the desk staff at the hotel stole my credit card information when I checked out and passed in onto the criminals who were making the charges.
reviews.title: Credit Card Fraud by Hotel Staff

likes.disliked: — Credit Card Fraud by Hotel Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from three nights at this hotel. We arrived on Friday Sep 29th around 11 am. We had taken a cab from Ft Lauderdale airport which cost about $46. Our room was ready when we arrived. This was our second stay here. We were here back in March of 2006. Our plan was to spend two full days relaxing on the beach enjoying the sun and warm water. Mission accomplished!
reviews.title: Nice family hotel with a great beach

likes.disliked: — no close by stairway from pool /beach to 3rd floor rooms

reviews.text: Great beachfront hotel. Stayed in the 2 bedroom suite with friends and loved it. Rooms did not smell, no pests etc.
reviews.title: Great Beachside Hotel
Just another hotel...... nothing spectacular
reviews.text: There is a lot of building work going on next door to the newport but if you have an i-pod or headphones then you won't hear the noise. It's not that bad anyway.

reviews.title: Newport Beachside Hotel and Resort
reviews.text: Bar staff great and really friendly.

reviews.title: Great getaway.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Newport Beachside for 5 nights over the recent new year.
As I work in the hotel industry I hope this helps.
reviews.title: Nice place, but not for non-smokers

reviews.text: We booked one night accommodation for mid November and arrived early (~8am) having just hopped off a cruise ship. We expected not to be able to check in, and just wanted to drop our bags off. What we didn't expect was the brisk "too early for check in!" we got upon walking up to the front desk, without a hello, or good morning. We left our bags, and arrived back at about 3.30 pm only to be told that our fully prepaid reservation would not be honoured because another guest had decided to stay an extra night. Newport paid for us to stay at another resort at Hollywood Beach which we were thoroughly disappointed with, and told us they would refund our prepayment. They also offered to pay for our transport to that resort (we had no car), but the money they gave did not cover the taxi fare.
reviews.title: Service lacking

reviews.text: When we arrived home I set about trying to get our prepaid reservation back and Newport were unhelpful with this (presumably because it was booked through a 3rd party). Perhaps they can't assist, but if this is the case, I'd prefer to have been told. The refund has not yet been credited.
reviews.title: Under renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At no point were we offered an apology for the inconveniences we incurred.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Place to Stay in Miami !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived here after a red eye from South America. It was 7:30 am and I knew there was a good chance my room wouldn't be ready. It wasn't, so they gave me a free voucher for their buffet breakfast, and told me that it would be most likely only 30-45 minutes before a room would be ready. The breakfast was pretty good. Nothing gourmet but it had an omlet bar, waffle bar, fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The service was very good.
reviews.title: A mixed bag

likes.disliked: — Hidden charges of almost $10 per day

reviews.text: The room was not ready until 9:30. When I got to the room, the whole floor (4th) was under renovations. I think it will be quite nice when it is done. The room was nothing special. The bathroom floor had not been cleaned. The hotel has a nice beach, a decent pool, and is within walking distance to other restaurants. Overall, not a bad place to stay if the rate is good. I got it for $50 through hotwire, which seemed like an excellent value.
reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for

reviews.text: Not a bad place to stay, just not that great either. We loved the beach and the pool but if you want to avoid crowds this isn't the place to be. All the rooms are smoking rooms and although there isn't a stale smell, there is a scent piped in that can be a little overwhelming. We never did figure out what it was. Ask for a room overlooking the pool. Avoid the street side, A1A is loud even at 3:00am! My biggest complaint is after 3 calls to guest services we never did receive any wash cloths! Overall, it was ok but we probably would not stay here again.
reviews.title: I expected more?

reviews.text: We stayed at the Newport Beach for a couple of nights. The room was clean and everything was in good repair. Unfortunately, some smokers had occuppied the room previously as there was a definite smell; however, your nose quickly became accustomed. We really liked the in-room safe.
reviews.title: Nice Family Place
Great Five days
reviews.text: The beach was in good shape, but we were there in the days previous to Hurricane Dennis so that may have changed. They had a nice big pool and a smaller children's pool. Lots of lounge chairs and soft fluffy towels. The hot tub was fairly cool, maybe 100F.

reviews.title: What an interesting experience!!!
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good. Excellent cooked to order omelets. The Italian restaurant was good, but could use a little more spice. The portions were huge. A nice wine list with everything in the $20-40 price range.

reviews.title: Not a bad hotel
reviews.text: We were very pleased with the service at the hotel, from the valet parking staff who went out of their way to give us directions (even though we had self-parked across the street), the front desk, and the waiters in both restaurants.

reviews.title: A few faults but all in all, a great place
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Newport, checking out on Aug. 2nd. I had read the reviews here so knew about the "across the street" parking issue and also the resort fee. Most hotels in Florida charge a resort fee now. One mistake we made was not paying the extra $20 or so a night to get an oceanfront room, so the view from our room was horrendous. However, the room, and bathroom were absolutely spotless and the maid service was excellent. This was a great place for families, as they had a lot of scheduled activities for the kids. There are little chickee huts on the beach where you can sit in the shade and their ocean access is gorgeous. My only complaint would be with the elevators. Be prepared to spend a good portion of your time here waiting on the elevators. Only two of their three were working, and those two are small and slow. The lines to get on the elevators were always long. The hotel has a beautiful lobby and two very good restaurants. So other than the elevator problem, I'd give this hotel very high marks. Oh, one more thing-- they were starting some renovations on the lobby just as we were checking out.

Stayed here for 3 nights in July -- actually tried to extend lodging, but they were sold out for family reunion. We loved our stay here. We had reserved a one bedroom, but when we got to our room it was a 3 (I think) bedroom -- possibly 2. It had 2 king beds and a Murphy bed (pretty sure it was queen). Had 2 bathrooms and a jacuzzi in one bedroom. Our balcony overlooked the pool and had a great ocean view.
reviews.title: Thought it was the perfect place for us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff was wonderful. My son was stung by a jellyfish and they were great. I had called ahead of time and asked them to arrange the room for his birthday, and it was a great surprise to him! Had cake, candles, utensils, plates, streamers, balloons, 2 souveniors---it made his day! Diane in the executive office was wonderful in helping to arrange this.
reviews.title: Good News: CHEAP. Bad News: (Read the Review!)

likes.disliked: — Cleanliness problems, parking situation, resort fee

reviews.title: "Family Vacation Spot" but ........
reviews.text: We never used the pool, but did participate in the children's activities, and there were plenty!

The beach was very nice. Groomed each morning. Yes, the pier was closed, but when I called a week ahead of our stay to inquire about the fishing, they were upfront about it, and that is why we didn't cancel. So glad we didn't.
reviews.title: Unbeatable Beach and Poll Area

likes.liked: — The overall cleanliness of the property, proximity of restaurants, plenty of activities
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping because no bed linen change or vacuuming

reviews.text: I was very unhappy with this resort. I saw that there was a very small area of beach, all the buildings are standing right over you. I didn't like the hotel cleanliness. The towels I used caused my face and chest to break out into red blotches. I also didn't like the construction noise at 7 o'clock at night. I paid 10 dollars for parking. The next day when I checked out, they tried to charge me for parking,, Again. There are far better places in Miami than here, do some looking around, but don't stay here.
reviews.title: Disappointed with hotel

likes.disliked: — walk to park across busy street, noise and towels that caused inflamed skin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing good about this hotel is the beach was clean. The hallways smell of urine and the rooms are dirty and smell of mold. Drapes and bedspreads all had holes in them. The staff is not helpful in anyway they have an I DONT CARE ATTITUDE. The hotel has alot of senior meetings going on and they have priority over the paying guests. The staff one night moved all the cars and didnt mark were they put them, so we all had to go looking for are cars the next day all in different parking lots and garages. You would think this would be the hotel responsabilty but wasnt. Also still was charged parking fees. For two days in a row there were a group of adults drinking and very rowdy. making everyone stay at the pool misarable. Several of us went and complained and were told nothing they can do about. On the 3rd day a fist fight broke out with 3 of the same men in the group and the police were called by one of the guests NOT the STAFF. They were finally asked to leave. Dont waste your money in this hotel there are alot of nicer cleaner hotels for the same price. DO YOUR HOMEWORK when choosing
reviews.title: Dirty hotel and lousy staff

reviews.text: Good location for beach get away. Walking distance to several restaurants and shopping. Pool and beach bars are fun. Pool is shaded in the afternoon, but no problem, just walk down the steps to the beach. Staff is friendly and let you enjoy yourself. Lobby was being remodeled, but should be finished by now. Rooms were much smaller than they appear on the website, not a problem if you don't intend to use the murphy bed in the suites, if you do, it is a bit cramped. Ocean views are great.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — room was cramped with murphy bed down

reviews.text: This hotel was the noicest that we've been to in a long time. When we got to the hotel, we were quickly taken up to our room with polite staff. Becase our original room smelled of smoke, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. The beach was gorgeous, and the huts were VERY convienent (although you had to fight over the best ones aka hut 4). The pool was shaded during the afternoon, but the beach was so gorgeous that it didn't matter. There was a delicious poolside resturant that brought you food on the beach. There was also a breakfast buffett that was VERY expensive and sucked. Although the hotel is very close to South Beach and Ft. Lauderdale, there is nothing to do around the hotel at night. Get a car! The decor was old, but the rooms were clean even though we saw a roach shimmy across our bedroom floor on the last night. Overall, our stay at the Newport Beachside Resort was a success, and we will definatlly be coming back next year!
reviews.title: Noice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The checkin staff was very unfriendly, did not make us feel welcome. There was construction in hotel lobby, as well as going on in nearby hotels - which translated into a LOT of noise which really disturbed us while we were trying to relax on the beach. We were also bothered by the activity director at the pool walking around the beach using a megaphone to recruit people for a volleyball tournament! When we made it to the room, it was clean as far as we could tell, however the bedding wasn't exactly fresh or new looking, pretty worn down. The blinds in the room were broken and missing in some spots, so there was harsh sun in the morning. Also, on the first day, we changed in the public bathrooms in the lobby b/c our room wasn't ready and we wanted to hit the beach - ALL of the toilets in the ladies room were "clogged" - not necessarily the hotel's fault, but does show that they have no one monitoring their restrooms or their cleanliness.
reviews.title: Pay the Money for a Nicer hotel!

likes.liked: — It was right on the beach.
likes.disliked: — Not at all a relaxing atmosphere

reviews.text: The staff is only friendly when your checking into this Boot Camp nightmare, must wear wrist bands when at the pool or beach area as if you were in jail or military boot camp (ID Bracelets). Staff is not friendly, rooms are really nice and great activities even though pool manager sucks as well. Pool closes at 10 and no hanging out in that area or beach area with our the Drill Sargent Security Guard hassling you so basically its lights off at 10:00 pm Sucks, No coolerss or music in these area either, will never stay again. I needed a vacation not a boot camp with so many rules and regulations. THIS PLACE SUCKS!!!!
reviews.title: Don't consider this Boot Camp.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the outside the Hotel building apprears to be very old. The lobby windows, elevators and carpet were dirty. Our room was changed three times, because they were dirty on arrival. They were not even third world country clean. Finally I figured that it was not worth it to keep changing rooms, so I cleaned the third room myself with clorox and lysol. There were fleas in our room, my husband and I were both bitten on our legs and arms.
reviews.title: Not a Very Clean Resort/Hotel

reviews.text: The beach was nice. Stay at this hotel only if you want to have easy access to the beach. If having access to the beach is not a priority, then stay some where else.
reviews.title: Great place for kids and families

likes.disliked: — some of the rooms don't have good views

reviews.text: Just got back from a week at the Newport. We had a positive experience at the hotel in general, especially after we switched to a nicer room. The first one they gave us, a 2 br suite, was toward the front, street side of the hotel, room 626, with a very ugly view out the window. After two nights and many requests, we moved to room 914, with a beautiful view of ocean and swimming pool. I recommend requesting a specific room number, keeping in mind that 901 is closest to the ocean, and 926 would be far from the water and not scenic. Room 914 was great.
reviews.title: Great Atmosphere but hated the room

reviews.text: The staff was nice and responsive, and my kids loved the pool and the ocean. The pool is rather noisy and crowded with children, and it was nicer to pay $10 for an umbrella at the water's edge (shade was essential.) The breakfast was okay, nothing great, but very convenient. The omlette bar was good. We also went across the street to Einstein's Bagels, and found very tasty Cuban and Peruvian restaurants in the strip malls across the street. (And great cafe con leche at the Cuban eatery.) The hotel lobby was very pleasant. It is far to get to South Beach, and not located near much other than the ocean, so probably not a top choice for singles or couples. But for my family, with two small children, the Newport provided a comfortable and relaxed setting for a week of play at the pool and beach.
reviews.title: Outstanding 6 day vacation

likes.liked: — Hotel staff and very clean hotel and property
likes.disliked: — slow connection for internet service in the room.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September and when we arrived I felt excuted at first. The hotel is located nearby the beach and has its own beach access but the more days we stayed the more remarks I gathered and finally I felt a little big negative about this hotel and next time I wouldn't stay here anymore although the accomodations are really nice :

Booked a 3 bedroom suite but upon entering the unit saw that it was 2 rooms beside each other and one seperate room. When I have stayed at other 3 room suites it was 3 rooms but there were 3 t.vs but the two rooms were right beside each other so the two tv beside each other were kinda distracting. The third bedroom was divided by a wall so not really like three rooms. The efficency was a small fridge and a microwave so you could have breakfast in the room but that was it. reviews.title: A beach wedding to Remember....
reviews.text: Lobbby was very nice and the nicest feature of the hotel. as you go upstairs it does not look as nice as the lobby. Nice ocean side pool. Had some kids activities. second pool next door but not available to the hotel. Not in a bad neighbourhood but far to walk to anything else. Basically looks like they will tear this place down and build a better condo or nice hotel. I would stay here as it is ocean side and if you get a good rate but the rooms are circa 1980. could do better but for the price we payed and in high season it was ok. Just ok

Planning an out of town wedding is never easy but having the right people in your corner makes it so much easier. I came across Newport Beachside Resort after doing a search on tripadvisor. I contacted Holly Pacheco who assisted me in chosing the right package. I chose the elopement package which included flowers, cake, the location, a night's stay in the hotel, an officiant (Viviana Sarno), dinner, breakfast, wine and strawberries. Everything I needed plus more! In addition I was able to use one of their banquet rooms which overlooked the pool to have a reception for 20 guest offering hourdevours from Micheal's Kitchen (restaurant at hotel). After the reception, my guest and I had a fabulous evening at South Beach(less than 20 minutes from hotel). I was able to throw together a very special day in less than 2 months with minimal effort and minimal money!!! Everyone involved was very helpful...I couldn't have done it without them...Thanks to all!
reviews.title: Great beach but rundown hotel

reviews.title: Better than expected - Would like to go back
reviews.text: ***Attached pictures were not taken by Golden Memories by Hazel

The rooms were exactly like the pictures, but felt a little smaller than how they looked online. Our room only had a medium refrigerator and a microwave, but actually servered our needs well for 6 nights. The room divider and 2 tv's were nice when staying in close quarters with anyone for more than a few days and probably kept the three of us from killing each other by day 5. (especially since the weather sucked and we had rain 4 out of 6 days and spent a good amount of time in the room.) I have no complaints about the accomidations and the spa tub was a nice bonus. I will warn you that the rooms do smell of smoke a bit, mostly because you can't open the windows to get fresh air in and there's no ventilation. For me and my traveling companions, 2 of us are smokers and the third didn't complain at all about the smell. I've smelled worse in other hotels and with the heat and the wind there I can see why they don't have a way to air it out. My only other warning is that the bar at the pool is pricey ($7 for a small bloody mary that wasn't very good. Tips are added for every drink automatically) There are a ton of kids in the pool and as I'm not one for screaming kids myself I was only mildly annoyed and was able to relax in the pool without much incident. The only complaint I have is with the music played all day. i love the calipso instrumental versions of the songs they played, but they only have 5 songs and after 6 days I felt like I was trapped in the "It's a Small World" ride because I heard a version of "Cocomo" 7,000 times while I was there...and the speaker was right outside my door and started at 8 am. We were reasonably close to south beach and the rental car was undamaged in the parking lot across the street, although we were carful not to leave anything in it because the security guard was asleep a few times when we came home late night and there were a lot of people hanging out at the gas station next door. The italian restaurant in the hotel was decent, with huge portions and decent prices, but if you are looking for a really good itialian dinner I'd recommend looking elsewhere. The food wasn't bad though and the metal containers the leftovers came back in actually were microwaveable, so again, no real complaints. I do with they would have combed the beach or something to get all of the debris off of it but it did rain the whole time we were there, so maybe they do.
reviews.title: It's a reasonable and roomy Hotel - Would return
We Loved Newport Beachside resort
reviews.text: My Girlfriend and I Stayed There for one week. It Was the BEST Time WE have ever had staying on the beach. I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews from other people On this site But please Disregard any kind of negativity About this hotel!!! The hotel was very Clean Except for the areas being renavated but those areas are away from public view The pool and beach Were Very clean And beautiful!! The italina Resturant was very nice with GREAT food And Great service and very affordable The ocean reef cafe was also very good They had breakfast buffet every morning for $21.00 For 2 people Not a bad price i don't think With all kinds of fresh fruit A chef that prepares omelets for you Yummy!!! There are many stores close by The miami market right up the street The have everything A marshalls across the street A swim wear shop very close too Cab rides to south beach costed about $30.00 There is a huge mall called adventurea Mall Very close the city bus can take you there for $1.50 Anyways back to the hotel I would tell any one to go there And will!! The only thing that did not impress me was when we checked in They did not tell us that they charge $5.00 a day resort fee but after i figured out whay they charge it i did not mind it included Use of beach towels The safe in the room, Beach Chairs The use of newport pier which is a must see!!!It was well worthe it This hotel is a excellent place for familys Or couples looking to get away If you are expecting something like South beach STAY IN SOUTH BEACH There is parasaing At the fountainbleau Resort down the street a bit and is very affodable Rooms are very nice and roomy but are all smoking rooms So for all you non smokers Thats life!!! If you are considering this place as your mimi beach location Please go there It is awesome!!! Take it for what it is worth!!!! if you want any Information On this resort please E-mail me and i will answer your questions straight away and we have many pictures

My husband and two young kids and I stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend. Our kids loved the hotel - they enjoyed the pool, the room size and the birds in the hotel lobby. I thought the room was a great size for a family of four, and with kids, the fridge and microwave came in handy. The beach was great as well and didn't get too crowded while we were there. On the negative side, we found the service to be uniformly TERRIBLE. I don't think we had one friendly or helpful exchange with a single staff person, from the desk clerk who checked us in (bored, surly and unhelpful), to the restaurant where we ate lunch (we showed up at 1:00 and stood waiting for some time, with staff people avoiding eye contact so they didn't have to seat us - I finally had to call to a waiter across the room and tell him we were sitting down!), to the maids who never said hello. The clientele was quite mixed, and there were not many families staying there, though it seemed there were a lot of families paying from the outside and using the pool, which got quite crowded. There was no lifeguard or any kind of supervision at the pool area, which gets really crowded on the shallow side. While we were there, a couple engaged in some inappropriate behavior at poolside - particularly in front of a pool full of kids!
reviews.title: Good and Bad Points, Especially for Families

reviews.text: I followed a piece of advice, call the hotel to make reservations. This place is a timeshare hotel and tends to overbook. When you do so request a printout of your confirmation. They tried to tell me that I was to check out the day before. They offered us a room in another hotel for $200/night or the same room for $200/night. I mentioned Trip Advisor and their previous reviews and by the time we got to our room they phoned and offered the additional night at the original rate. They also charged for an extra car for valet parking. This is a nice hotel for families. The rooms are all smoking but didn't smell that bad. The pool area is great but construction next door is continuing. There is plenty room to store belongings but the suite is small. The fitness center is average with a treadmill, a couple of bikes and weight machines. The guy who runs the center needs to learn gym etiquette. Just because he is having a personal training session doesn't mean he should turn off the TV that I was watching while bicycling without asking and turn on "Saturday Night Fever" or turn off the fan while my husband & I were working out because his session is over. I guess they don't know how to deal with the regular paying customers. I wouldn't ever stay there again.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings for this place

reviews.text: Just returned from the Newport last night. I was there with my 2 year old son, an old friend and her 1 year old daughter. I will start with what I DID like about the hotel ( refuse to call it a resort). The beach was awesome. We rented the tiki huts every day and they were a blessing. We could not ask for more as far as ammenities -nice pool, great kids pool, perfect beach, the Coconuts grill served great drinks (try the Tropical Paradise - yummy). The food was awesome, big juicy burgers, peel & eat shrimp, fried fish & fries, etc... However, I was so dissapointed to see that every time I ordered something, tax and 17% gratuity was included. No matter what I ordered, and no matter if I had to wait for it or if it was delivered to me pool-side or on the beach, the tip was included. I feel that I should decide how much to tip someone. I also feel that the staff attitued was poor because of this. (why should they work harder for you when they're already being tipped???) The italian restaurant was okay, but again the staff was totally unacommodating. We asked for napkins to clean up a spill and the guy lauged, then asked how many we wanted. HELLO!!! As many as it takes to clean up the mess!! Every time I asked the vallet guys to recommend somewhere to eat with the kids, they just looked at me and shrugged their shoulders. The only place that we loved was Tuna's, about a 10 minute drive and it was awesome. We asked where we could do some shopping and they sent us to the boardwalk in Hollywood which was nice, but they never suggested that we go to downtown south beach (shame on us for being clueless I guess).
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My traveling companion and I booked this place, on the basis of some tepidly okay TA reviews. Flying out of FLL.. the hotels that way are either VERY pricey or not good at all. We hoped Newport would be adequate. And it was. But barely.
reviews.title: It could have been a lot worse.

likes.liked: — it was about a half hour to the airport in Fort Lauderdale and it wasn't a great deal of money.
likes.disliked: — it was a pretty frantic place.

reviews.title: Great hotel--nice employees
reviews.text: Were it not for the bellman Alejandro, it could have been a disaster. While I checked on the valet parking ($15 for valet, $10 to self park) my partner went with him to our first room. it was apparent someone had 'crashed' in there for a while, as there were glasses and other stuff scattered about. So he got us moved to a much nicer room six floors up.

One elevator wasn't working and the other's were crammed with people. We waited 10 minutes before we could grab an elevator that would accomodate us and our things. We left the bellman's 'gurney' .. no way would it fit in an elevator. I think Alejandro climbed six floors to bring us hanging clothes we'd accidently left behind. The pier is blocked off on the ocean and the place was crawling with kids.
reviews.title: blah

reviews.text: But it did fit that decent category which wasn't easy in N. Miami Beach.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Newport for 3 weeks last month. The front desk staff was very helpful, the food was above average and the housekeeping was outstanding. One employee of the restaurant, Jenny Pereyra (not positive about the spelling), really stood out. Ms. Pereyra worked both the breakfast and lunch shifts and was extremely pleasant and always made sure my drinks were full and the table was clean. I can't say enough about how pleasant she was.
reviews.title: More than met our needs.

likes.liked: — the size of the room, location of the hotel

reviews.title: Newport Beachside Resort
reviews.text: This was my second time at this resort. Since the last year they have painted the outside which was an improvement. The inside is still very nice and clean. The service is fast and friendly. The views are great of the beach. The beach is right out the back door of the resort with huts and lounge chairs. The pool is a nice size with a baby pool and hot pool to the side. There is live entertainment while at the pool. The resort is minutes from malls and resturants. There are plenty of eating places and stores within walking distance. I would stay here again.

We just returned from one of the greatest vacations ever. After reading some of the reviews, i was a little nervous to say the least. The minute that i walked into this place i knew that we would have a great time. The hotel manager, Michelle Theodule, went out of her way to make sure that my family was well taken care of. She was very professional, polite and even upgraded our room to an oceanfront suite. Our room was clean and spacious with everything that we needed. The valet attendants, front desk people, concierge, pool attendants and housekeeping staff were top notch. The activities for kids and adults were both fun and entertaining. The pool area was well kept and clean. The beach was awesome with the huts and palm trees, giving it a tropical feel.
reviews.title: The most incredible time ever!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Overall, Michelle and her staff made our vacation one to remember.
reviews.title: Had a Wonderful Experience!
Much better than expected and we are picky!
reviews.text: Thanks to everyone at the Newport beachside!!!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Newport for one night prior to my cruise departure with my husband and six year old. We thought the hotel was great! The staff was very accommodating and the property was clean. My only complaint would be that the rooms were a bit out dated, but I was informed by the hotel that they're in the process of renovating the rooms.

aka: Newport Beachside Hotel Sunny Isles Beach
description: Just minutes from Miami and Fort Lauderdale, Newport Beachside Resort offers world-class services combined with outstanding value in a beautiful oceanfront setting. 300 guest rooms include those with an ocean or cityscape view and those with balconies overlooking the ocean. Resort amenities feature oceanfront pool, on-site restaurants, cabanas, children's playground and historic pier.
